intro: Ateleia cubensis var. orientensis, commonly known as the oriental sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. The tree produces fluffy, cotton-like seeds that are dispersed by the wind. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. Its bark is thick and flaky, and it can reach heights of up to 20 meters.
